basic.description: This course surveys the art, architecture; and visual culture of Spain's overseas colonies during the period of Bourbon imperial rule (1700-1821/1898). It examines a wide array of visual expressions, including painting, sculpture, architecture, urban space, prints, ephemera, ceramics, furniture, and clothing. In the course of this survey, the relationship between art and such issues such as colonialism, race, gender, and social hierarchy are considered.
basic.subject: ARH
basic.title: Spanish Colonial Art: The Bourbon Period; 1700-1821/1898
